alert.note: Alert for York (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 5:19PM EDT until further notice by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following county, York. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 515 PM EDT, Automated rain gages were showing storm total rainfall in excess of 1.5 inches in many locations. In addition, doppler radar was depicting heavy tropical showers continuing to redevelop into the region. An additional inch or two rain may fall through mid-evening. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area, especially across greater Rock Hill and select low-lying area elsewhere across the county. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rock Hill, York, Southwest Charlotte, Fort Mill, Tega Cay, Clover, Newport, Lesslie, Sharon, Hickory Grove, Mcconnells, Smyrna, Lake Wylie, Kings Mountain State Park, Carowinds, Catawba, Bethany, Edgemoor and Bullock Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
